item.title: Killington Snow Report for Tuesday, March 12, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 119
Open Lifts: 14
Groomed Trails: 42
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed / Spring Conditions
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 0"
48 Hour Snowfall: 0"
7 Day Snowfall: 4"

News and Events:
8:33 a.m. 3/12/13 - Spring conditions continue into the week as warm temperatures stick around for Tuesday! As sometimes happens with spring, things could get a little damp out there, so grab your Gore-Tex and get the best of soft bumps and smooth corduroy as our groomers take on 66 of the open trails overnight. Think soft, soft bumps on Lower Ovation, and fresh carving on East Fall, Wildfire, and Cascade, just to name a few.

Skiers and riders can look for top to bottom spring turns across our six peaks. And while we're putting the Stash woods to bed for a moment, look for over 94 terrain park features including one of our biggest jumps ever, a Boardercross course and the Superpipe!

Bump bashers, cruisers, or even brand new skiers and riders, there're 71 miles of terrain out there and one is guaranteed to be your new favorite.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $80 for adults (19-64), $68 for seniors (65+) and $62 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

Bump bashers, cruisers, or even brand new skiers and riders, there're 71 miles of terrain out there and one is guaranteed to be your new favorite.

item.title: Killington Snow Report for Monday, March 11, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 139
Open Lifts: 13
Groomed Trails: 65
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed / Spring Conditions
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 0"
48 Hour Snowfall: 0"
7 Day Snowfall: 5"

News and Events:
9:02 a.m. 3/11/13 - Some clouds are in the forecast, but the warm weather is sticking around. There will be plenty of soft snow and spring conditions for everyone to enjoy on 6 peaks with over 3000 vertical feet to cruise down.

Our amazing groomers were out making corduroy on trails all around the mountain overnight! That means wall-to-wall grooming on 68 of our open trails for fresh tracks. For the mogul fanatics out there check out seeded bumps on Upper Mouse Run, Mouse Trap and Outer Limits.

Skiers and riders can look for amazing cruising, top to bottom, across our six peaks. Look for over 100 terrain park features, bumps, and some long cruising trails like Great Eastern.

Our park crew continues to be hard at work so you can hit features in four parks, a Superpipe with four features at the end and a Boardercross Course. Plus, The Stash woods are open and waiting for you.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $80 for adults (19-64), $68 for seniors (65+) and $62 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

item.title: Killington Snow Report for Sunday, March 10, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 140
Open Lifts: 19
Groomed Trails: 77
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed / Loose Granular
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 0"
48 Hour Snowfall: 0"
7 Day Snowfall: 5"

News and Events:
7:26 a.m. 3/10/13

**Please note: the Ramshead Express Quad will have a delayed opening due to ongoing grooming. Time estimate 8:15 a.m. Thank you for understanding. **

We hope you set your clock for daylight savings time, because today is going to be another great one and you shouldn’t miss it! The sun will be shining this morning and temperature are on the rise. There will be soft spring-like snow all around Killington! Don’t forget we are 100% open with 71 miles of open trails waiting for you.

Our amazing groomers were out making corduroy on trails all around the mountain last night. That means wall-to-wall grooming on 77 of our open trails for fresh tracks. For the mogul fanatics out there check out seeded bumps on Upper Mouse Run, Mouse Trap and Outer limits.

Skiers and riders can look for amazing cruising, top to bottom, across our six peaks. Look for over 100 terrain park features, bumps, and some long cruising trails like Great Eastern.

Our park crew continues to be hard at work so you can hit features in four parks, a Superpipe with four features at the end and a Boardercross Course. Plus, The Stash woods are open and waiting for you.

Please note: Upper Bunny Buster will be closed and Highline will be closed from 8:00 a.m. -3:00 p.m. Thanks in advance for your understanding.

Key lifts spin at 8:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $88 for adults (19-64), $75 for seniors (65+) and $68 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

item.title: Killington Snow Report for Saturday, March 09, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 140
Open Lifts: 19
Groomed Trails: 77
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed / Packed Powder
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 0"
48 Hour Snowfall: 4"
7 Day Snowfall: 6"

News and Events:
3:21 p.m. 3/9/13 - Sunday is looking to be another great one here. It should be mostly sunny, with temperatures in the 40s, wow! Spring conditions and hero snow all around. If you’re not here you should be packing the car to get here!

Our amazing groomers will be out making corduroy on trails all around the mountain tonight. That means wall-to-wall grooming on 73 of our open trails for fresh tracks. For the mogul fanatics out there check out seeded bumps on Upper Mouse Run, Mouse Trap and Outer limits.

Skiers and riders can look for amazing cruising, top to bottom, across our six peaks, including some sweet gladed trails, complete with some stashes for the dedicated powder hunter. Look for over 100 terrain park features, bumps, and some long cruising trails like Great Eastern.

Our park crew continues to be hard at work so you can hit features in four parks, a Superpipe with four features at the end and a Boardercross Course. Plus, The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Also, check out the freshly rebuilt and cut mini-pipe on Timberline.

Please note: Upper Bunny Buster will be closed and Highline will be closed from 8:00 a.m. -3:00 p.m. Thanks in advance for your understanding.

Key lifts spin at 8:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $88 for adults (19-64), $75 for seniors (65+) and $68 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

News and Events:
7:54 a.m. 3/9/13

It’s going to be an amazing bluebird day here at Killington! If you haven’t already made your way here, pack the car and head up for a beautiful day of skiing and snowboarding!

Our amazing groomers were out making corduroy on trails all around the mountain last night. That means wall-to-wall grooming on 79 of our open trails for fresh tracks. For the mogul fanatics out there check out seeded bumps on Upper Mouse Run, Mouse Trap and Outer limits.

Skiers and riders can look for good things top to bottom across our six peaks, including some sweet gladed trails, complete with some stashes for the dedicated powder hunter. Look for over 100 terrain park features, bumps, and some long cruising trails like Great Eastern.

Our park crew continues to be hard at work so you can hit features in four parks, a Superpipe with four features at the end and a Boardercross Course. Plus, The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Also, check out the freshly rebuilt and cut mini-pipe on Timberline.

Please note: Upper Bunny Buster will be closed and Highline will be closed from 8:00 a.m. -3:00 p.m. Thanks in advance for your understanding.

Key lifts spin at 8:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $88 for adults (19-64), $75 for seniors (65+) and $68 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

item.title: Killington Snow Report for Friday, March 08, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 139
Open Lifts: 19
Groomed Trails: 79
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed / Packed Powder
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 4"
48 Hour Snowfall: 4"
7 Day Snowfall: 7"

News and Events:
3:12 p.m. 3/8/13 -- Four awesome inches of snow one day, bluebird skies forecast for the next! Can it get any better than this? Turns are already soft and fun here at Killington, so more snow is the icing on the cake. Plus, the clouds are disappearing so get ready for an amazing Saturday!

Our amazing groomers will be making corduroy on trails all around the mountain tonight. That means wall-to-wall grooming on 71 of our open trails for fresh tracks. For the mogul fanatics out there check out seeded bumps on Upper Mouse Run, Mouse Trap and Outer limits.

Skiers and riders can look for good things top to bottom across our six peaks, including some sweet gladed trails, complete with some stashes for the dedicated powder hunter. Look for over 100 terrain park features, bumps, and some long cruising trails (for reference, see Great Eastern, which will take you all the way down to Skyeship Base).

Our park crew continues to be hard at work so you can hit features in four parks, a Superpipe with four features at the end and a Boardercross Course. Plus, The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Also, check out the freshly rebuilt and cut mini-pipe on Timberline.

Please note: Upper Bunny Buster will be closed and Highline will be closed from 12:00-4:00 p.m. Thanks in advance for your understanding.

Key lifts spin at 8:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $88 for adults (19-64), $75 for seniors (65+) and $68 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

Our park crew continues to be hard at work so you can hit features in four parks, a Superpipe with four features at the end and a Boardercross Course. Plus, The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Also, check out the freshly rebuilt and cut mini-pipe on Timberline.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $80 for adults (19-64), $68 for seniors (65+) and $62 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

item.title: Killington Snow Report for Thursday, March 07, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 140
Open Lifts: 13
Groomed Trails: 67
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed / Packed Powder
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 0"
48 Hour Snowfall: 0"
7 Day Snowfall: 11"

News and Events:
3:06 p.m. 3/6/13 -- SNOW! It’s snowing here this afternoon and should just get better! Forecasters are calling for the fluffy white stuff to continue to fall through tomorrow night! Turns are already soft here at Killington, so this will just make it better! Plus, we're 100% open!

We will have plenty of fresh corduroy Thursday, as our amazing groomers will be out hitting the trails overnight working their magic. That means wall-to-wall grooming on 71 of our open trails for fresh tracks. Are you thinking smooth turns and easy cruising? Because that's what we'll have.

Skiers and riders can look for good things top to bottom across our six peaks, including some sweet gladed trails, complete with some stashes for the dedicated powder hunter. Look for over 100 terrain park features, bumps, and some long cruising trails (for reference, see Great Eastern, which will take you all the way down to Skyeship Base).

Our park crew continues to be hard at work so you can hit features in four parks, a Superpipe with four features at the end and a Boardercross Course. Plus, The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Please note Upper Timberline will be closed Wednesday and Thursday to rebuild the Minipipe.

Please note: Upper Bunny Buster will be closed from 12:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m. and Needle’s Eye from 9:00-11:30 a.m. Thanks in advance for your understanding.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $80 for adults (19-64), $68 for seniors (65+) and $62 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"

48 Hour Snowfall: 1"
7 Day Snowfall: 21"

News and Events:
4:43 p.m. 3/5/13--Twenty one inches of snow in seven days? We'll take that, Mother Nature. And we don't mind the snow forecasted through Friday either.

We'll be looking forward to turns on fresh corduroy on Wednesday, as our amazing groomers will be hitting the trails overnight and letting the snowcats play. That means wall-to-wall grooming on 71 of our open trails for fresh tracks. Are you thinking smooth turns and easy cruising? Because that's what we'll have.

Skiers and riders can look for good things top to bottom across our six peaks, including some sweet gladed trails, complete with some stashes for the dedicated powder hunter. Look for over 100 terrain park features, bumps, and some long cruising trails (for reference, see Great Eastern, which will take you all the way down to Skyeship Base).

Our park crew continues to be hard at work so you can hit features in four parks, a Superpipe with four features at the end and a Boardercross Course. Plus, The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Please note Upper Timberline will be closed Wednesday and Thursday to rebuild the Minipipe.

Please note: Highline will be closed all day along with Upper Bunny Buster and Needle’s Eye from 1:00-4:00 p.m. Thanks in advance for your understanding.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $80 for adults (19-64), $68 for seniors (65+) and $62 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

item.title: Killington Snow Report for Tuesday, March 05, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 140
Open Lifts: 13
Groomed Trails: 69
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed / Packed Powder
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 1"
48 Hour Snowfall: 1"
7 Day Snowfall: 21"

News and Events:
7:52 a.m. 3/5/13 One inch of new snow and there's a chance for perfect Vermont snowflakes in the forecast - Happy Tuesday from Mother Nature! Better yet, today looks like more of the same sweet turns on 100% of our 71 miles of open terrain - yep, we're starting off the week with the most open terrain in the East.

Steeps, trees, groomed cruisers? Yep, we've got them all, not to mention seeded and natural bumps and parks and pipes! The grooming crew will be working overnight on Outer Limits and Mouse Trap, so check out the fresh seeded bumps for your Tuesday morning bashing. In addition, they'll be leaving some soft new corduroy on 68 trails.

Our park crew has built tons of features for your jibbing pleasure in four parks, plus The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Additionally, the Superpipe, Minipipe and Boardercross Course at Snowshed Slope are open.

Please note: Highline and Needle's Eye will be closed for racing from 9:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $80 for adults (19-64), $68 for seniors (65+) and $62 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

item.title: Killington Snow Report for Monday, March 04, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 140
Open Lifts: 14
Groomed Trails: 73
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed / Packed Powder
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 0"
48 Hour Snowfall: 1"
7 Day Snowfall: 20"

News and Events:
6:31 a.m. 3/4/13 - Great news, snow is in the forecast through Wednesday night! Plus, Killington is 100% open with 71 miles of open terrain for you to make turns down - yep, we're starting off the week with the most open terrain in the East.

Whatever you are looking for, we have you covered with steeps, trees, groomed cruisers, seeded and natural bumps, parks and pipes!

Our groomers will be making some sweet corduroy on 74 trails – from the top of Killington Peak to Skyeship Base, that’s over 3,000 vertical feet of corduroy.

Our park crew has built tons of features for your jibbing pleasure in four parks, plus The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Additionally, the Superpipe, Minipipe and Boardercross Course at Snowshed Slope are open.

Please note: Highline will be closed for racing from 9:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $80 for adults (19-64), $68 for seniors (65+) and $62 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

Our park crew has built tons of features for your jibbing pleasure in four parks, plus The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Additionally, the Superpipe, Minipipe and Boardercross Course are open.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $88 for adults (19-64), $75 for seniors (65+) and $68 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.

item.title: Killington Snow Report for Friday, March 01, 2013
item.description:
Killington Conditions:
Open Trails: 140
Open Lifts: 16
Groomed Trails: 77
Service Conditions: Machine Groomed/ Packed Powder
Average Base Depth: 36" - 42"
24 Hour Snowfall: 8"
48 Hour Snowfall: 18"
7 Day Snowfall: 25"

News and Events:
Killington is 100% open and 100% awesome. With eight inches of fresh pow last night this brings our two-day total to 18 amazing inches of fun! Main trails will have packed powder conditions for some great carving, and there is still plenty of powder stashes in the woods! With snow forecasted through Sunday, expect to see natural bumps form on some of our favorite trails like Superstar, Outer Limits and Lower Skyelark.

If your legs need a break from all the pow, our awesome groomers have you covered with 72 groomed trails – from peak to creek, that’s over 3,000 vertical feet of corduroy! You know how we do!

Our park crew will be digging out features for your jibbing pleasure in four parks, plus The Stash woods are open and waiting for you. Additionally, the Superpipe, Minipipe and Boardercross Course are open.

Key lifts spin at 9:00 a.m. Lift tickets will be $80 for adults (19-64), $68 for seniors (65+) and $62 for youths (7-18).

Killington promotes inbounds skiing or snowboarding only on open, designated trails, slopes, freestyle and tree skiing areas. Never ski or snowboard alone.
